advancement.label: Advancement
advancement.description: When you've marked all four, clear & advance

trauma.label: Trauma
trauma.description: When you witness a scene of violence or victimization and do nothing, mark trauma and corruption.

advancements.label: Advancements
advancements.description: Available at the beginning of play:

expertAdvancements.label: Expert advancements
expertAdvancements.description: After five advances, you may select:

corruptionAdvances.label: Corruption advances
corruptionAdvances.description: Corruption represents your character slipping toward the worst parts of their nature. As your corruption mounts, your powers only grow...

4.label: take a new corruption move from another archetype or your own

5.label: retire your character; they may return as a Threat

MortalRelationships.label: Mortal Relationships (Choose 3):
MortalRelationships.description: While you ride the line between the mortal and supernatural worlds, your friends and family are stuck firmly in the mundane realities of everyday life. When one of your mortal relationships comes to an end for any reason—they cut you off, they die, they leave the city, you tell them to stop contacting you, etc.— immediately mark a corruption advance. If losing a mortal relationship causes you to retire your character due to corruption, tell the MC whom you most blame for the loss; your character will pursue the person responsible as a Threat until "justice" is served.

options.0: A younger sibling who relies on you for transportation and advice
options.1: A loyal significant other who expects you home by midnight
options.2: A struggling best friend who's always getting into messy altercations
options.3: A demanding boss who calls you into work at inconvenient times
options.4: An elderly parent who always knows when you're lying to them
options.5: An overbearing ex-partner who constantly worries about you

options.0: Nature's Caress: Your touch heals 2-harm, starting with critical harm; wounds close, bones knit back together, etc. You cannot use this power on yourself.
options.1: Wither: You can imbue your touch with the power to kill (3-harm intimate ap). The effect is instantly understood by the target as an attack and leaves behind a nasty mark or scar at the point of contact.
options.2: Glamours: You create illusions to fool the senses. The effects don't last long, but they are compelling. You cannot disguise or conceal yourself or your actions with these tricks.
options.3: Shape Change: You can change your shape into that of a small animal—a bird, a mouse, a snake, a fish, etc.—for a scene. Up to three people you designate can still understand your speech, but everyone else perceives you to be barking, chirping, etc.
options.4: Bedlam: You can touch a vulnerable target to place them in a specific emotional state (your choice) for the scene. Mark corruption to have that emotion directed toward a target of your choosing.

Court.label: YOUR COURT
Court.description: You belong to a faerie court, presided over by a monarch to whom you have sworn loyalty. Your monarch holds 2 Debts over you; tell the MC what favors they granted you to earn such holdings. Your court is...

options.0: baroque and formal
options.1: savage and unruly
options.2: aloof and cold
options.3: mysterious and exotic

MonarchsStanding.description: Your monarch's standing is represented by…

options.0: a crown, magically imbued with your court's royal authority
options.1: a scepter, forged from the elements of your court
options.2: a magical aura, unconcealable by even faerie magics
options.3: a seat of power, capable of summoning your entire court

options.0: a jealous sibling; you owe them a Debt for their loyalty
options.1: a former lover; you owe them a Debt for their kindness
options.2: an old mentor; you owe them a Debt for their tutelage
options.3: a contemptuous peer; you owe them a Debt for their patience

Society.label: YOUR SOCIETY
Society.description: You belong to a society of hunters, an affiliation of fellow mortals who stalk dangerous prey to protect the mortal world from the supernatural. Tell your MC to stat up your society as a Size-2, Strength-2 faction within Mortalis. WHAT IS YOUR PREY?

options.0: vampires who feed on the weak and coerced
options.1: demons who corrupt the good and the just
options.2: angels who subjugate the will of the faithful
options.3: ghosts who plague the lives of the innocent
options.4: wizards who abuse their power and authority

Sacrifice.description: WHAT DID YOU SACRIFICE TO JOIN?

options.0: my soul, forever tainted by magic ritual
options.1: my family, forever excised from my life
options.2: my childhood, forever lost to my training
options.3: my body, forever scarred by ceremony

options.0: a swanky, expensive hotel
options.1: a dive bar or gambling den
options.2: a union or veterans hall
options.3: hallowed religious ground

Establishment.label: YOUR ESTABLISHMENT
Establishment.description: You once served a powerful demon, but you seized upon a loophole in your contracted fealty and won your freedom. Now you cater to supernatural clientele from all four Circles, securing your place in this world...for now. By default, your establishment has a permanent location, a small but loyal staff, and many regular customers. Choose two services you offer:

options.0: Transporting and selling otherworldly creatures
options.1: Appraising and auctioning magical relics and artifacts
options.2: Creating forgeries, disguises, and stolen identities
options.3: Providing news, gossip, and rumor to the city at large
options.4: Operating a gathering place; name the relevant Circle

Investments.description: Choose two investments you've made over the years:

options.0: A skilled bodyguard dedicated solely to your security
options.1: An expansive, expert staff appropriate to your services
options.2: A secure venue, impenetrable by intruders and thieves
options.3: A magical dead zone secured by wards and ritual
options.4: A Status-3 regular in another Circle; take three Debts on them

Plague.description: Choose two problems that plague your business:

options.0: A dangerous competitor edging in on your market
options.1: A hard-to-move acquisition attracting unwanted attention
options.2: A besmirched reputation complicating any new deals
options.3: A demonic ex-liege seeking your immediate return
options.4: A severe state of disrepair endangering your staff

SchemesText.label: YOUR SCHEMES
SchemesText.description: Schemes are risky deals and shady cons designed to expand your business. When you generate a scheme, choose a primary Circle, one of your services, and two complications—the MC will tell you what opportunity you've seized upon. When you accomplish a scheme, select two boons and a payout; the MC will detail how they arrive. Generate a scheme whenever a boon or a move tells you to generate a new scheme. COMPLICATIONS: • you promised someone involved something you don't yet have • you require an unreliable or untrustworthy co-conspirator • you must fool or deceive a powerful and dangerous NPC • you need to steal something from a secure location • you need to wait for a predetermined time or event • you have attracted the attention of dangerous opposition. BOONS: • attract new business; generate a new scheme • pay down your debts; cancel a Debt you owe • throw your weight around; take a Debt on an NPC • grow your reputation; mark a Circle affected by the deal.

SchemePayouts1.label: PAYOUTS
SchemePayouts1.description: Available at the start of play:

options.0: +1 any Circle (max+3)
options.1: hire Fiendish Underlings
options.2: acquire an arsenal
options.3: secure a new investment

options.0: +1 any Circle (max+3)
options.1: +1 Status (max+2)
options.2: acquire a legendary weapon
options.3: acquire a sanctum
options.4: get 2 new let it out abilities

Benefactor.label: YOUR BENEFACTOR
Benefactor.description: You have a benefactor, a powerful NPC whose fate is intertwined with your own; you came into their service as a result of your prophetic visions, but they now demand more and more from you and your powers. Name their Circle—Mortalis, Night, Power, or Wild—and choose the prophecy that binds you together, two strengths, and two flaws: (Ask the MC what life your benefactor has provided for you after you make your choices. Their continued largesse depends on how well you serve their interests.)

options.0: they alone can guide you to the mystical answers you seek
options.1: they alone can protect you from a dark fate you have foreseen
options.2: they alone can destroy a uniquely evil foe within their own Circle
options.3: they alone must play a critical role in the war against a coming darkness

options.0: they are a Status-3 member of their Circle
options.1: they speak truthfully and honor their word
options.2: they wield significant supernatural power
options.3: their minions are disciplined and loyal

options.0: they are terrifyingly violent and cruel
options.1: they have defenses against your sight
options.2: they are at war with powerful enemies
options.3: they are madly in love with you

Trauma.label: TRAUMA
Trauma.description: Your sense of self has been shattered by your death, leaving you traumatized. You begin each session with at least 2-trauma marked, but can clear it—and any additional trauma you take—via trauma moves. If you ever fill your trauma track, the MC may call for you to make a trauma move at any time, but you may always choose which trauma move you make in the moment. The first time you take harm in a scene, mark trauma; when you fill up on harm, your corpus is scattered. Mark trauma to reform in a few days at one of your anchors, or mark 3-trauma to reform immediately at an anchor of the MC's choice. If you cannot mark trauma while destroyed, the MC decides how/when you reform.

Anchors.label: ANCHORS (Choose 4):
Anchors.description: You have several anchors in the city—important places, people, or objects that keep you from moving on. You might have an opportunity to put an anchor to rest, but anchors can also be ruined or destroyed. (When one of your anchors is put in danger, you know; mark trauma and take a +1 ongoing to all moves until you see it to safety. When you resolve an anchor, clear your trauma track and erase a corruption advance; when an anchor is destroyed or ruined, fill your trauma track and take a corruption advance.)

options.0: a family member or inheritor, unaware of your existence
options.1: a witness to your death, bound to you by chance or fate
options.2: a friendly household pet, constant companion in your unlife
options.3: a beloved possession of your youth, passed to a new owner
options.4: a marker of your success in life, now claimed by another
options.5: an item related to your death, grimly marking your violent end
options.6: a location of personal importance, a reminder of a past love
options.7: a space you used to live or work, abandoned by the world

PassingOn.label: PASSING ON
PassingOn.description: When your last anchor is resolved or destroyed, you pass on; pick one blessing or haunting you bestow upon the city for each one of your anchors that was resolved or destroyed, respectively. If all four of your anchors are destroyed, you do not pass on, but are instead swallowed by oblivion and inflict all three hauntings. BLESSINGS:

options.0: you inspire an NPC to forgive someone who once wronged them, ending a long-standing conflict
options.1: you cleanse or restore a cherished place once thought by all to be ruined or beyond repair
options.2: you heal or restore someone you once injured or wronged
options.3: you reveal to an NPC the truth of your death and passing

options.0: you leave behind a psychic reflection of your fear and anger, a terrible thing that hunts mortals in the night
options.1: you imbue an object with nightmarish power; the MC chooses who ends up with the cursed item
options.2: you drive an NPC close to you into a downward spiral

OathMasters.label: YOUR MASTERS (choose one):
OathMasters.description: You've sworn an oath to serve an influential faction of Power, an organization that relies on you to protect its members, punish its enemies, and defend its holdings. Tell your MC to stat up your masters as a Size-3, Strength-3 faction within Power. Ask them what you know about the organization's structure, culture, and assets.

options.0: an abbey of prescient oracles
options.1: a council of haughty wizards
options.2: an order of secret immortals
options.3: an academy of religious scholars

options.0: protecting and policing their members
options.1: recovering lost artifacts and tomes
options.2: investigating threats and problems
options.3: destroying those who would thwart them
options.4: negotiating with their allies and vassals

Vows.label: YOUR VOWS, You must… (choose 5):
Vows.description: When you break one of your vows, mark corruption. When you take a corruption advance, cross out one of your vows—it no longer binds you. If you strike out every vow, your oath is broken—change playbooks immediately.

options.0: ...never trespass on another's property
options.1: ...never strike the first blow
options.2: ...never lie about your identity or purpose
options.3: ...never reveal your faction's secrets
options.5: ...always protect members of Power from harm
options.6: ...always thwart the enemies of your masters
options.7: ...always seize that which your masters desire

OathWeapon.label: YOUR LEGENDARY WEAPON (Choose one):
OathWeapon.description: Your masters have given you a weapon (3-harm mythic anchored) to wield, a legendary artifact of an age long lost. So long as you bear this legendary armament, advance the named move. When you wield the weapon in the service of your masters, you can roll with Mind instead of Spirit when you keep your cool. But your weapon—like your oath—is bound to your loyalty. If your oath is broken, the weapon will be lost to you, even betraying you to ensure it exits your service.

options.0: a sword wielded by rightful kings (figure someone out)
options.1: a knife cut from demonic steel (mislead, distract or trick)
options.2: a spear stolen from heaven itself (let it out)
options.3: an axe forged in the blood of gods (turn to violence)
options.4: a staff imbued with stealthy sorcery (escape a situation)
options.5: a hammer blessed by otherworldly magic (keep your cool)

DarkPatron.label: YOUR DARK PATRON (Choose 2):
DarkPatron.description: Your soul has fallen into the hands of a dark patron, a powerful demon whose reputation precedes them, but whose true name is known to few. They have given you terms of employment, access to terrible power, and terrifying insight into their true nature.

options.0: they seduce all who come into contact with them with pleasantries, gifts, and vices
options.1: they govern their sprawling organization through strict and severe rules and punishments
options.2: they require deference from their minions to their strange obsession with a mortal pastime
options.3: they manipulate their friends, allies, and enemies alike into conflicts that serve their secret designs
options.4: they have seeded eyes and ears across the city, always alert to any sign of betrayal or profitable opportunity
options.5: they employ only dedicated and loyal minons who are all too happy to report on your activities
options.6: they are slow to anger, but their commitment to their wrath is unstoppable once truly provoked

YourDemonForm.label: YOUR DEMON FORM
YourDemonForm.description: Since your patron claimed your soul, you have a new look: a demon form. Pick as many as apply from the lists below:
YourDemonForm.value:
• Head: bone, concave, crown, flames, halo, horns, spikes
  • Eyes: absent, animal, empty, glowing, smoky, un-blinking
  • Limbs: claws, heavy, hoofed, many, severed, twisted
  • Wings: blood, feathers, insects, leather, metal, paper, none
  • Skin: chitinous, marked, misty, sticky, stretched, translucent

DemonicJobs.label: DEMONIC JOBS
DemonicJobs.description: Your dark patron keeps you on Earth for a reason; they could always have decided to drag you to hell. Choose two jobs you regularly do for them from the list below:
DemonicJobs.value: Collecting souls, tracking down rogue demons, delivering threats and messages, cleaning up gruesome messes, guarding someone or something, destroying your patron's enemies, brokering demonic contracts, hiding and securing demonic contraband, operating a demonic establishment, policing your patron's minions

options.0: Tired
options.1: Scared
options.2: Hurt
options.3: Angry

dialog.title: Welcome to PbtA Template
dialog.content: Would you like to use this module's custom startup screen?

img.name: Use the Module Login Image?
img.hint: If set to true: use the module login img; if set to false: use the default or user set login image.
